intro: Billotia linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved billotia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Billotia linearifolia is often found in shrublands and is adapted to withstand dry and windy conditions.
